Working with the Link Pane

The Link pane shows the items to which a selected folder or item has been linked. For example, a file might be linked to a folder, another file, a change request, a requirement, a task, or a topic. To see the properties of the item at the "other" end of the link, you can double-click the item in the Link pane or right-click and select Link Properties from the context menu.

In the Link pane or the Folder Properties dialog, you can click column headers to sort and group the links. For example, to sort the links by the type of item to which they are attached, click the Item Type column head.

The default columns that appear on the Link pane include:

Created By

Name of the user who created the link.

Created On

Date/time at which the link was created.

View

Name of the view containing the link. If the link was created in a reference view, this is the name of the parent view.

Folder

Name of the folder in which the folder or item in the Link pane resides.

Item Type

Type of item to which the target end of the link is attached; possible values include Folder, File, Change Request, Requirement, Task, or Topic.

Item

Specific item to which the target end of the link is attached. It is identified by folder name, file name, change request number, task number, or topic number.

Item Details

Description of the item.

Item Version and Selection Version

Revision numbers that appear when the ends of a link are pinned to specific folder or item revisions. Item Version displays the version number of the target end of the link, while Selection Version displays the revision number of the source end of the link. If no revision number appears in a column, that end of the link is floating rather than pinned.

Comment

Comment entered about the link on the Link Properties dialog.

Folder Path

Path shown only when linked item is in the same view.

Using the Link Context Menu

The Link context menu appears when you right-click an item on the Link pane. Options available on the context menu include:

Item Properties

Review the properties of the folder or item.

Link Properties

Review or edit the properties of the link. For example, you can change whether the link's attachment to an item floats or is fixed.

Delete Link

Delete the link.

Pin Link

To Source Item at Tip: Pins the link to the tip revision of the link source

To Target Items at Tip: Pins the link to the tip revision of the link target.

To Source and Target items at Tip: Pins the link to the tip revisions of both the link source and link target.

Float Link

To Source Item: Allows the link source to float from tip revision to tip revision as new revisions are created.

To Target Items: Allows the link target to float from tip revision to tip revision as new revisions are created.

To Source and Target Items: Allows both the link source and link target to float from tip revision to tip revision as new revisions are created.

Linked File

Enabled when one or more files from the current view have been selected in the Links pane.

Check In:  When this option is selected, the system presents the standard Check In dialog and the files will be checked in.

Check Out: When this option is selected, the system presents the standard Check Out dialog (minus the View Configuration option). If the link is pinned, the files checked out will be the revisions that were linked. If the link is floating, the files checked out will be the tip revisions.

Attach Label: When this option is selected, the system presents the standard Label Selection dialog (minus the View Configuration component).  If the link is pinned, the files attached will be the revisions that were linked. If the link is floating, the files attached will be the tip revisions.

Detach Label: When this option is selected, the system presents the standard Detach Label dialog. The selected labels will be detached from the selected files.

Compare Contents (only one file selected): When this option is selected, the system presents the Visual Diff tool. For a pinned link, the local file on disk is compared to the revision that is linked. For a floating link, the local file is compared to the tip revision.

Select Linked Item

Enabled when a single item from the current view has been selected from the Links pane. When this option is selected, the item's parent folder is selected in the folder tree, the item type is selected in the items pane, and the item itself is selected in the list or tree on the upper pane of the main window. If the item is not visible with the current filter and query settings, the user will see a warning that the selection could not be completed.
